DataElement.preferredName: NHS II Activity and Inactivity Questionnaire Flights of Stairs Climbed Daily Category
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Persons' stated observation of how many flights of stairs (not individual steps) they climb daily, using a category to describe the number of flights.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Nurses' Health Study II Activity and Inactivity Questionnaire Flights of Stairs Climbed Daily
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A self-reported questionnaire designed to measure physical activity and inactivity in a cohort of nurses who were recruited in 1989 and were between the ages of 25 and 42 at recruitment._A question about how many flights of stairs an individual climbs daily.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Nurses' Health Study II Activity and Inactivity Questionnaire
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A self-reported questionnaire designed to measure physical activity and inactivity in a cohort of nurses who were recruited in 1989 and were between the ages of 25 and 42 at recruitment.

Concepts.longName: Nurses' Health Study II Activity and Inactivity Questionnaire
Concepts.definition: A self-reported questionnaire designed to measure physical activity and inactivity in a cohort of nurses who were recruited in 1989 and were between the ages of 25 and 42 at recruitment.

Property.preferredDefinition: A question about how many flights of stairs an individual climbs daily.

Concepts.definition: A question about how many flights of stairs an individual climbs daily.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response that indicates climbing 15 or more flights of stairs daily.

Concepts.definition: A response that indicates climbing 15 or more flights of stairs daily.
